contents.text: Appendix A: List of RFC's for each Area
contents.zh-CHS: 附录A：每个区域的RFC清单

contents.text: The following list contains the RFC's grouped by area that were searched for year 2000 problems.
contents.zh-CHS: 以下列表包含按区域分组的RFC，这些区域用于搜索2000年问题。

contents.text: Each line contains three fields are separated by '::'. The first filed is the RFC number, the second field is the type of RFC (S = Standard, DS = Draft Standard, PS = Proposed Standard, E = Experimental, H = Historical, I = Informational, BC = Best Current Practice, '' = No Type), and the third field is the Title.
contents.zh-CHS: 每行包含三个字段，用“：：”分隔。第一个字段是RFC编号，第二个字段是RFC类型（S=标准，DS=标准草案，PS=建议标准，E=实验性，H=历史性，I=信息性，BC=最佳当前实践，''=无类型），第三个字段是标题。

Appendix B: Automatic Script to Implement Methodology
contents.zh-CHS: 附录B：实现方法的自动脚本

contents.text: #!/usr/bin/perl
# Program to read text files (such as RFCs and Internet Drafts) and # output items that might relate to year 2000 issues, particularly # 2-digit years.
contents.zh-CHS: #程序读取文本文件（如RFC和互联网草稿）并输出可能与2000年问题有关的项目，特别是两位数年份。

contents.text: # Version 1.1a. Slight modification by Philip J. Nesser # (phil@nesser.com) to split lines from old RFC's that are # too wide to conform with current RFC standards.
contents.zh-CHS: #版本1.1a。Philip J.Nesser的轻微修改(phil@nesser.com)从旧的RFC中分割线，这些线太宽，不符合当前的RFC标准。

contents.text: # Version 1.1. By Paul Hoffman (phoffman@imc.org). This is a # quick-and-dirty hack and could be written more elegantly and # more efficiently. There may be bugs in this software. For # example, there was an off-by-one-line bug in version 1.0. # Use this code at your own risk. This code may be freely # redistributed.
contents.zh-CHS: #版本1.1。保罗·霍夫曼(phoffman@imc.org). 这是一个快速而肮脏的黑客行为，可以写得更优雅、更高效。此软件中可能存在错误。例如，在1.0版中有一个离线错误使用此代码的风险自负。此代码可以自由重新分发。

contents.text:
# Some people like using disk files, others like STDIN and STDOUT.
#    This program accomodates both types by setting the $UsageType
#    variable. 'file' means input comes from the first argument on
#    the command line, output goes to that filename with a ".out"
#    extension; 'std' means STDIN and STDOUT.
$UsageType = 'file';  # Should be 'file' or 'std'

# @CheckWords is a list of words to look for. This list is used in # addition to the automatic checking for "yy" on a line without "YYYY". # You might want to add "year yyyy" to this list, but then a large # proportion of the RFCs and drafts get selected
contents.zh-CHS: #@CheckWords是要查找的单词列表。除了在没有“YYYY”的行上自动检查“yy”之外，还使用此列表您可能希望将“yyyy年”添加到此列表中，但随后会选择大部分RFC和草稿

contents.text: @CheckWords = qw(UTCTime two-digit 2-digit 2digit century 1900 2000);
# Read the whole file into an array. This is a tad wasteful of memory # but makes the output easier.
contents.zh-CHS: #将整个文件读入数组。这有点浪费内存，但会使输出更容易。

Appendix D: Discussion of HTTP 1.0 Issues
contents.zh-CHS: 附录D：HTTP 1.0问题的讨论

contents.text: HTTP:
contents.zh-CHS: HTTP:

contents.text: The main IETF standards-track document on the HTTP protocol is RFC2068 on HTTP 1.1. It notes that historically three different date formats have been used, and that one of them uses a two-digit year field. In section 3.3.1 it requires HTTP 1.1 implementations to generate this RFC1123 format:
contents.zh-CHS: HTTP协议上的主要IETF标准跟踪文档是HTTP 1.1上的RFC2068。它指出，历史上使用过三种不同的日期格式，其中一种使用两位数的年份字段。在第3.3.1节中，需要HTTP 1.1实现来生成此RFC1123格式：

contents.text: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT  ; RFC 822, updated by RFC 1123
instead of this RFC850 format:
contents.zh-CHS: 代替此RFC850格式：

contents.text: Sunday, 06-Nov-94 08:49:37 GMT ; RFC 850, obsoleted by RFC 1036
contents.zh-CHS: 1994年11月6日星期日08:49:37 GMT；RFC 850，被RFC 1036淘汰

contents.text: Unfortunately, many existing servers, serving on the order of one fifth of the current HTTP traffic, send dates in the ambiguous RFC850 format.
contents.zh-CHS: 不幸的是，许多现有服务器，服务于当前HTTP流量的五分之一，以不明确的RFC850格式发送日期。

contents.text: Section 19.3 of the RFC2068 says this:
contents.zh-CHS: RFC2068第19.3节规定：

contents.text: o HTTP/1.1 clients and caches should assume that an RFC-850 date which appears to be more than 50 years in the future is in fact in the past (this helps solve the "year 2000" problem).
contents.zh-CHS: o HTTP/1.1客户端和缓存应假定RFC-850日期（看起来在未来超过50年）实际上已经过去（这有助于解决“2000年”问题）。

contents.text: This avoids a "stale cache" problem, which would cause the user to see out-of-date data.
contents.zh-CHS: 这避免了“过时缓存”问题，这将导致用户看到过期数据。

contents.text: But to avoid unnecessary delays and bandwidth indicated in Scenario 2 below, this should be extended to say that a date which appears to be more than 50 years in the past may be assumed to be in the future, if a future date is legal for that field.
contents.zh-CHS: 但是，为了避免下文场景2中所述的不必要的延迟和带宽，应将其延长，以表示如果未来日期对该领域是合法的，则可以假设过去似乎超过50年的日期是在未来。

contents.text: Scenario 3 indicates that servers may also want to follow these rules.
contents.zh-CHS: 场景3表明服务器可能也希望遵循这些规则。

contents.text: Here is some more background and justification for these arguments.
contents.zh-CHS: 下面是这些论点的更多背景和理由。

contents.text: The following headers use full dates:
contents.zh-CHS: 以下标题使用完整日期：

contents.text:
HTTP/1.0:
        Date:
        Expires:                # can be in the future
        If-Modified-Since:      # required to be in the past
        Last-Modified:          # required to be in the past
        Retry-After:            # can be in the future, also takes
                                        # relative time - number of seconds

HTTP/1.1:
        If-Range:
        If-Unmodified-Since:    # required to be in the past
Note that clock skew between hosts can lead to confusion here - see the RFC for details.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，主机之间的时钟偏差可能会导致此处的混乱-有关详细信息，请参阅RFC。

contents.text: Here are some scenarios of the implications of RFC850 dates, which include stale caches, unnecessary requests for things, which are validly cached, delays for the user, extra bandwidth, and presenting incorrect information to the user.
contents.zh-CHS: 以下是RFC850日期含义的一些场景，其中包括过时的缓存、对有效缓存的事物的不必要请求、用户延迟、额外带宽以及向用户呈现错误信息。

contents.text: Some cases involve comparisons with the current time, and others may involve comparisons between dates from different sources. The abbreviation "/99" is used to imply an RFC850 date with the value "99" for the year.
contents.zh-CHS: 有些情况涉及与当前时间的比较，另一些情况可能涉及来自不同来源的日期之间的比较。缩写“/99”用于表示RFC850日期，该日期的值为“99”。

contents.text: RFC850 date from server
contents.zh-CHS: 来自服务器的RFC850日期

contents.text: Scenario 1: If a client gets an Expires /99 date after the year 2000, it should interpret it as 1999, to avoid ending up with a stale cache entry.
contents.zh-CHS: 场景1：如果客户机在2000年之后获得Expires/99日期，则应将其解释为1999年，以避免以过时的缓存条目结束。

contents.text: This is as already specified in RFC2068.
contents.zh-CHS: 这已在RFC2068中规定。

contents.text: Scenario 2: If a client gets an Expires /00 date before the year 2000, and subsequently is faced with a choice to either retrieve the document from its cache or look for an updated copy, it may interpret it as the year 2000, to avoid the unnecessary delay and bandwidth of an extra request.
contents.zh-CHS: 场景2：如果客户机在2000年之前获得Expires/00日期，并且随后面临从其缓存检索文档或查找更新副本的选择，则它可能会将其解释为2000年，以避免额外请求的不必要延迟和带宽。

contents.text: RFC850 date from client
contents.zh-CHS: 来自客户的RFC850日期

contents.text: Scenario 3: If a server gets an If-Modified-Since /99 date from a client after the year 2000, it should interpret it as 1999 when comparing with the local modification date, in order to possibly avoid sending a full GET response rather than a HEAD response.
contents.zh-CHS: 场景3：如果服务器从2000年之后的客户机获得一个If-Modified-Since/99日期，那么与本地修改日期相比，它应该将其解释为1999年，以避免发送完整的GET响应而不是HEAD响应。

contents.text: Note that an If-Modified-Since header must never be in the future.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，If-Modified-Since标头以后绝对不能出现。
